translation

Class Block

  • java.lang.Object
    • translation.Block

  • public class Block
extends java.lang.Object
    A block of code of the Kitten intermediate language. There is no jump to or from internal points of the code inside the block.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Block(BranchingBytecode condition, Block yes, Block no)
      Builds a block of code containing nop, with no predecessors and two successors.
      Block(CodeSignature where)
      Builds a block of code containing nop and with no successors nor predecessors.
      Block(FinalBytecode bytecode)
      Builds a block of code containing a final bytecode and having no predecessors nor successors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doNotMerge()
      Specifies that this block cannot be merged when prefixed with a bytecode.
      java.lang.String dotNodeName()
      Yields a string identifying this node in a dot file.
      BytecodeList getBytecode()
      Yields the bytecode inside this block.
      java.util.List<Block> getFollows()
      Yields the successors of this block.
      void linkTo(Block follow)
      Adds a successor to this block.
      Block prefixedBy(Bytecode bytecode)
      Adds a bytecode before this block.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Block

        public Block(FinalBytecode bytecode)
        Builds a block of code containing a final bytecode and having no predecessors nor successors.
        Parameters:
        bytecode - the final bytecode

      • Block

        public Block(BranchingBytecode condition,
             Block yes,
             Block no)
        Builds a block of code containing nop, with no predecessors and two successors. The branching to the two successors is decided on the basis of a Boolean condition. The condition and its negation are prefixed to the code of the two following blocks.
        Parameters:
        condition - the branching bytecode that decides the branching
        yes - the block of code to be executed if the condition holds. This should not be null
        no - the block of code to be executed if the condition does not hold. This should not be null

      • Block

        public Block(CodeSignature where)
        Builds a block of code containing nop and with no successors nor predecessors.
        Parameters:
        where - the method or constructor where the block will be put

    • Method Detail

      • getFollows

        public java.util.List<Block> getFollows()
        Yields the successors of this block.
        Returns:
        the list of successors

      • linkTo

        public void linkTo(Block follow)
        Adds a successor to this block.
        Parameters:
        follow - the successor to be added to this block. This should not be null

      • doNotMerge

        public void doNotMerge()
        Specifies that this block cannot be merged when prefixed with a bytecode. See prefixedBy(Bytecode).

      • getBytecode

        public BytecodeList getBytecode()
        Yields the bytecode inside this block.
        Returns:
        the bytecode inside this block

      • prefixedBy

        public Block prefixedBy(Bytecode bytecode)
        Adds a bytecode before this block. This results in the same block being modified or in a new block linked to this.
        Parameters:
        bytecode - the bytecode which must be prefixed to this block
        Returns:
        the result of prefixing bytecode to this block

      • dotNodeName

        public java.lang.String dotNodeName()
        Yields a string identifying this node in a dot file.
        Returns:
        a string identifying this node in a dot file
